intro: Acmispon argophyllus var. adsurgens, commonly known as the tall blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect, sparsely branched stems and small, blue to purple flower clusters. The plant has trifoliate leaves composed of three oval to lance-shaped leaflets, and it produces elongated, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and gravelly slopes.
